meanings.definition: Not using resources efficiently or cost-effectively.
meanings.sent1: The uneconomical car guzzled gas quickly.
meanings.sent2: It is uneconomical to leave the lights on when not at home.
meanings.sent3: The uneconomical use of paper towels led to a shortage in the office.
meanings.sent4: Her shopping habits were so uneconomical, she was always broke.
meanings.sent5: The uneconomical air conditioning system made the electricity bill skyrocket.

meanings.definition: Wasteful or inefficient in the use of resources.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the water running while brushing your teeth is uneconomical.
meanings.sent2: The uneconomical packaging of the product resulted in excessive waste.
meanings.sent3: His uneconomical spending on unnecessary gadgets left him with empty pockets.
meanings.sent4: The uneconomical use of time led to missed deadlines.
meanings.sent5: The uneconomical irrigation system wasted water and increased costs.
